fields.description: to enable Configure time for saving drafts
fields.summary: Configure time for saving drafts

fields.description:
Refer to [CRC-1732|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-1732]

Same perforce configuration works in Fisheye but not in perforce light plugin. There isn't any plugin errors.
fields.summary: Perforce light plugin doesn't work

fields.description:
Currently you have to go Add Content -> Browse Changesets then the "Diff To ..." option in "Add To Review As".

Its not very discoverable and its actually quite a pain to use. Its easier just to create a patch review and anchor it to the repo than bother with the Crucible UI.
fields.summary: Make it easier to create a review from two changesets

fields.description:
Created by Seb Ruiz from Joe Xie''s Crucible comment on CrucibleUser.hbm.xml line 26 https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3641#c32124 :

does it matter if a property was removed from here, but not removed from the table (say, via an upgrade script)?
fields.summary: Create an upgrade task to remove multi frx option from db

fields.description:
Hi,

I attempted to delete a Crucible project by navigating to Admin > Project List > Delete. I then received the option to "Permanently delete all reviews in project" or "Move all reviews in project to existing project" and chose to move to another project. After clicking "Delete Project" the following error was given.

Your request was unable to be processed
org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException

    * Could not execute JDBC batch update
    * failed batch

You are running release CR2.3.1 FE2.3.1 (build-482 2010-05-27), please report your release number when reporting bugs.

Thanks,
Marcus
fields.summary: Delete Crucible project bug

fields.description: After removing Multi-frx mode from Crucible, reviews are totally screwed up in Internet Explorer.
fields.summary: [IE] Reviews are broken

fields.description:
It currently looks all broken like so:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100625-pem68shacy6pnf8dwkjgx7ksrk.jpg!

And can look so much better:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100625-bhibewcq7ruh7w1fgqt6dfdc95.jpg!
fields.summary: The JIRA Add Time hover UI is disrupted when the spinner is invoked

fields.description:
When attempting to auto link a JIRA issue and an issue is encountered we simply don't link, but offer the user the "link to" option.

If this link is clicked, though, the returned message is jammed in to the page and disrupts the UI.

This needs to be more elegantly handled:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100625-di6xgwe6aqmimykrnbjt4b8p88.jpg!
fields.summary: We need to more elegantly handle the message from JIRA when it can't find an issue or there are permission problems

fields.description:
Currently if a server response is encountered by an ajax request, it is delivered as a fully fledged Web page, not a JSON response.

Geoff's under the opinion that the upgrade to jQuery 1.4 has resulted in jQuery's inability to filter out the BODY element - jQuery can deal with legal child elements of BODY, but not BODY or HTML elements.

As a result the messages are coming back empty and are of no use to the recipient:
!http://img.skitch.com/20100625-rwrsf9sgyg4ag4jiej7pax484f.jpg!
fields.summary: Error dialogs need to have useful messages

fields.description:
Quite a lot of the time I don't really care about the directory structure that a file is in so much. When reviewing a deeply nested file, the # comments for a file (end of file) almost inevitably gets cropped.  And is on a 24"

!http://img.skitch.com/20100624-bjb95eskeqppwejrkcmg6emsqh.png!

in IDEA you can collapse packages like:

!http://img.skitch.com/20100624-qmrfbi62k4gtpgc22y4u2qki5t.png!

which works for random folders as well, minimising nesting to just the one level. I think this would be a neat additional option for Cru
fields.summary: Ability to "Flatten Folders"

fields.description:
Its quite difficult to discover how to rename a user in FishEye/Crucible. We should add a rename link next to where we have Edit, Reset Capture etc

!http://img.skitch.com/20100623-chkbx3bsxcsc61hxby8b3efrmd.jpg!
fields.summary: Make the rename user functionality more visible

fields.description:
Split the crucible dashboard review filter links into a tree like hierarchy:
h5. My Reviews
* Inbox (12)
** To review (4)
** To summarise (5)
** In draft
** Requiring approval
** Open with unread comments (3)
* Outbox
** Out for review
** Awaiting approval (if I'm not the moderator)
** Awaiting summary (if I'm not the moderator)
** Open reviews
* Archive
** Closed reviews
** Abandoned reviews

The inbox and outbox counts should be sum of all the counts of their children, without duplicates. They should be collapsible, and the outbox should be collapsed by default.

The inbox link should be clickable and take the user to a filter which shows all of the child reviews. That is - all of the reviews which have an action which is waiting for the user.

The link title attributes should have a full description - eg "My reviews awaiting summary by the moderator"
fields.summary: The unified Crucible inbox

fields.description:
For instances with thousands of users or hundreds of projects/repositories, selects are unusable.

These should be replaced with autocompletes everywhere in the product. For example, the crucible custom filter, the manage files constraints forms and the fisheye activity stream filter.

* User dropdowns should be ajax autocomplete
* Repositories and projects should be pre-populated in the page
fields.summary: Replace all project/repo/user selects with autocomplete inputs

fields.description:
Bug in Jetty can cause OOME - java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: requested 239288 bytes for Chunk::new. Out of swap space?

Native heap is leaked by the JVM if you do not explicitly close of gzip streams. Jetty has this outstanding bug which shows it is affected by this problem:

* http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY-1167

The stack trace shows: 

{noformat}Caused by: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
	at java.util.zip.Deflater.init(Native Method)
	at java.util.zip.Deflater.<init>(Deflater.java:123)
	at java.util.zip.GZIPOutputStream.<init>(GZIPOutputStream.java:46)
	at org.mortbay.servlet.GzipFilter$GzipStream.doGzip(GzipFilter.java:481)
	at org.mortbay.servlet.GzipFilter$GzipStream.<init>(GzipFilter.java:373)
	at org.mortbay.servlet.jetty.IncludableGzipFilter$IncludableGzipStream.<init>(IncludableGzipFilter.java:62)
	at org.mortbay.servlet.jetty.IncludableGzipFilter$IncludableResponseWrapper.newGzipStream(IncludableGzipFilter.java:53)
	at org.mortbay.servlet.GzipFilter$GZIPResponseWrapper.getOutputStream(GzipFilter.java:297)
	at javax.servlet.ServletResponseWrapper.getOutputStream(ServletResponseWrapper.java:112)
	at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.CommitActivityChartAction.processChart(CommitActivityChartAction.java:158){noformat}

We should try and work around it, or upgrade to a later version of Jetty if its fixed there.
fields.summary: Upgrade Jetty >= 6.1.23

fields.description:
it should either scroll on the edge of the error box, or not scroll (have a button to copy the stacktrace instead?). 
||original||desired||
|[!http://img.skitch.com/20100525-cx36a3ni2brjim1ae2win78c88.png|width=300!|http://skitch.com/chii/dfb95/fisheye-changeset-59275]|[!http://img.skitch.com/20100525-rwqf8mhx7mus5a72nmifgi1bpg.png|width=300!|http://img.skitch.com/20100525-rwqf8mhx7mus5a72nmifgi1bpg.png]|
fields.summary: GWT error box stack trace causes too much horizontal scroll

fields.description:
AUI must be upgraded to the latest version.
This will involve:
* Auditing the components that we use in FishEye & Crucible
* Removing the forked version of AUI which FishEye uses
* Removing the jQuery scripts which we include as it is provided by AUI
* Porting our front end code to use the new api
* Investigating if there are any better ways of implementing our aui components in AUI 3
fields.summary: Upgrade AUI to the latest version of 3.x

fields.description:
We would like to be able to enter a comment on a line of code and add a link to another piece of code within the same file (or another file in the review).
For example, "this code is repeated. See also [Foo.java,145-180]"
fields.summary: to enable wiki links in crucible comments

fields.description:
Go to https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-PLE-234
I get something like:
{noformat}
com.cenqua.crucible.model.FileRevisionException: java.io.IOException: svn: '/svn/!svn/bc/58843/PLE/PLE/trunk/com.atlassian.connector.eclipse.crucible.core/src/com/atlassian/connector/eclipse/internal/crucible/core/client/CrucibleClient.java' path not found: 404 Not Found (https://studio.atlassian.com)
{noformat}


this {{...PLE/PLE...} looks suspiciously.

Also remote API does not serve anything reasonable for this review.
fields.summary: Problems on AtlasEye - com.cenqua.crucible.model.FileRevisionException

fields.description:
If a reviewer is uncompleted on a review, which they then subsequently complete, the JIRA time logger is not taking in to account any previously submitted time.
Its just tacking it on to the running tally.

Submitting time should(/did?) reset the timer.

!http://img.skitch.com/20100621-x8erbpbq324b2c4g88s2rsrrke.jpg!
fields.summary: JIRA time tracking regressed

fields.description: When you hover over these buttons, the background goes dark blue (which is good) but you can only actually click the text or arrow, not anywhere in the darkened section.
fields.summary: "View" and "FishEye" dropdowns should have a greater clickable surface

fields.description:
After clicking it, I don't expect the updates stuff to be bolded, I expect everything else to go away. I also expect the "Show only updated" link to be replaced with a "Show everything" link or to at least disappear.

It's confusing - either the text of the link should be changed  (maybe to "highlight updated files") or the behaviour should be changed.
fields.summary: "Show only the updated links" is misleading

fields.description: Clicking this link doesn't do anything in IE7. I believe it should make the updated files bold or something.
fields.summary: "Show only the updated links" in Cru doesn't work in IE7

fields.description:
Created by Joe Xie' from Matt Quail's Crucible defect on WebServer.java line 129 https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3593#c31719 :

since we are calling {{setKeyPassword()}} then we implicitly support jetty's {{OBF:} prefix stuff. And if we do, then we should use that OBF stuff when we set the password from admin
fields.summary: make passwords obfuscated

fields.description:
There has been a lot of requests around administration features in FE and Cru, but as far as I can see, so far there still is no way to create and/or configure FE repositories or Cru projects and similar administrative functions over a _remote_ API (i.e., REST).

Please correct me if this impression is wrong, I would love to have this ASAP for automated, uniform project creation over our full Atlassian-based infrastructure. Since services are often isolated via VMs, using a local/Java API is infeasible, and writing one's own remote API using plug-ins seems like a huge waste of time since you have remote APIs that are halfway there, but mostly read-only and don't expose administrative features.
fields.summary: Administrative API for FE/Cru

fields.description:
Created by Arthur Lee from Seb Ruiz's Crucible comment on reviewPage.tag line 248 https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3625#c31805 :

I don't think this link needs to go in the tools menu. Seems overkill when it is only useful when writing wiki text – at which point there is a help icon anyway.
fields.summary: We need wiki preview and help buttons when editing GWT comment

fields.description:
When completing a review and opting to submit time to JIRA, the hover's submit button needs to close the hover and change the submit request text to a success message _and_ remove the link so the same time can't be submitted twice

!http://img.skitch.com/20100617-biaiebnxgr38hi7wcwcdfw95eg.jpg!
fields.summary: Remove JIRA time submit hover onclick to reduce double posting time

fields.description: If you are already logged into Crucible, hitting the /login url should take you to the dashboard, unless there is a referrer url in which case the redirect should take the user to the specified url
fields.summary: When visiting /login when already logged in, redirect to the dashboard

fields.description:
Okay we need something far less subtle than that, but its a start!

!http://img.skitch.com/20100617-tdm46bin6c147q8y2ipygntbgb.jpg!
fields.summary: Icons in the sidebar to denote changesets/patches would help differentiate the review and content type

fields.description:
Administrator should be able to delete review. Rationale:
- when moderator of the review is deleted there's no straightforward way of removing such review,
- moderator may get sick or leave the job -> in that case administrator should be able to easily delete review or at least easily change the moderator.
fields.summary: Administrator should be able to delete reviews

fields.description: The committer case is not converted to lower case in the review coverage report page and it causes a broken link. See the attached screen shot.
fields.summary: Committer link is broken in the Review Coverage Report page

fields.description: After crucible update from 2.2.3 to 2.3.2 review filter doesn't show any review. But after review update (add comment, join review, whatever) it becomes visible in filters.
fields.summary: After crucible update from 2.2.3 to 2.3.2 review filter doesn't show any review.

fields.description:
I intend to use only lightSVN repos due to myriad indexing problems. This will allow me to use crucible without fisheye. 

However, I'd like to be able to set the default repo for a crucible project to a lightSVN repo, otherwise the user always needs to select it (from 630 repos).
fields.summary: Ability to set a LightSVN repo as the default repo for a crucible project

fields.description: http://img.skitch.com/20100616-erca8kq4eyuk2dsxumfibdfb14.png
fields.summary: Error after reloading review to pick up new comments
Any time the user needs to login to continue, redirect to the login page, with a return URL and enough state to continue

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce the problem:

- Ensure already logged out of JIRA and Crucible.
- Logged into JIRA. Picked a particular issue.
- Clicked on the source tab and Create Crucible Review.
- It goes to Crucible with the error message, "You must login to add to a review" Refer to the attachment.

- This was tested with Crucible 2.1.2.
- The user names do have camel case, but the option "force lower case" is off.
- The users authenticate through Crowd 1.6.1 that reads from an ldap source.
fields.summary: Single Sign-On problem from JIRA to Crucible

fields.description: remove the option, and all associated UI components.
fields.summary: remove multi-FRX mode from Crucible

fields.description:
Created by Joe Xie' from Matt Quail's Crucible defect on WebServer.java line 127 https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3593#c31722 :

have a look at ProxyPassingSelectChannelConnector. It is a very specific hack/fix to ensure that we work correctly wrt X-Forwarded-Host headers.

Can you write a unit test (unit test of WebServer) that ensures we do the right wrt to X-Forwarded-Host for http and ssl connectors.

You may need to refactor customize() out of ProxyPassingSelectChannelConnector and make a ProxyPassingSslSocketConnector
fields.summary: have a look at ProxyPassingSelectChannelConnector. It is a very specific hack/fix to ensure that we work correctly wrt X-Forwarded-Host headers.  Can you write a unit test (unit test of WebServer) that ensures we do the right wrt to X-Forwarded-Host fo...

fields.description:
Created by Joe Xie' from Matt Quail's Crucible defect on config.xsd line 166 https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3593#c31699 :

u prob also want to be able to specify the (optional) trust store (and its password) as per [this jetty doco|http://docs.codehaus.org/display/JETTY/How+to+configure+SSL#HowtoconfigureSSL-Step4%3AConfigureJetty]
fields.summary: u prob also want to be able to specify the (optional) trust store (and its password) as per [this jetty doco|http://docs.codehaus.org/display/JETTY/How+to+configure+SSL#HowtoconfigureSSL-Step4%3AConfigureJetty]

fields.description:
Created by Joe Xie' from Matt Quail's Crucible comment https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3593#c31727 :

make a jira for mstudman so he knows to add this to the gwt ui
fields.summary: gwt-ize the SSL admin UI.

fields.description:
Created by Joe Xie' from Matt Quail's Crucible comment https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3593#c31708 :

this will need a metric truckload of documentation (and checking that the documentation is right). raise that jira please. This jetty doco is a good start
http://docs.codehaus.org/display/JETTY/How+to+configure+SSL
fields.summary: Create SSL doco. Incl how to create a keystore.

fields.description:
I loved the Snippets feature when I first saw it.

However, a Snippet IMO is really just another type of media but Crucible does not agree. I can't add reviewers to a Snippet and therefore none of Crucible's nice workflow features are available to them.

Snippets have a different UI for comments. The inline comments are nice - in fact, nicer than the ones for reviews. There are no general comments.

I would like the ability to add code or anything else (error message, etc) to a review without having to check it into version control. Current options include (1) Use Objectives (2) create JIRA ticket (3) create wiki (Confluence) page. We have tried all of the options. Most folks use the Objectives field.

Snippets as-is are nice but are too feature deficient for them to work for us.
fields.summary: "Snippets" for regular reviews

fields.description: It's not possible to add comments to a review when viewing it with Safari on the iPad. There are some other problems as well (e.g. scrolling requires two fingers), but not being able to add comments is the one issue that makes Crucible completely unusable on he iPad.
fields.summary: Cannot add review comments on ipad

fields.description:
from support https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-1711

user tried to search from the dashboard, project, and review page, but NPE. User does not have any repositories configured, and is using litescm to create reviews.
fields.summary: global quicksearch throws a NullPointerException if there are no repositories

fields.summary: Review of a confluence page when confluence instance was removed from cruicible
The "Add all x revisions" option is broken
use safe parameter interceptor
Changeset discussions are always included on project pages, regardless of content

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1. Make a comment on a changeset in repository 'x'
2. Delete repository 'x'.
3. Go to the project page of the crucible project that was previously associated with 'x' 
4. View comment ... 

We should clear any changeset discussions associated with 'x' in RepositoryAdminService.delete
fields.summary: Changeset disscussions aren't deleted when a repository is deleted

fields.description:
I have seen this in an in-house Crucible install and now in JIRA studio as well but never had reproducible steps before.

Basically, if one tries to delete a file from a CR from the Review tab while the file has the "Done" check box on, it fails with a cryptic error message: "No revision was added or removed. Could not execute JDBC batch update."

After toggling the file's "Done" check box off (and refreshing the page, as the delete button is now disabled), I can delete the file without problems.
fields.summary: cryptic error attempting to remove a file from a change set

fields.description:
When a user views a file in a Crucible review based on Fisheye data that's invalid, they're presented with an ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.  This only happens if the underlying Fisheye data is invalid, for example if the file exceeds the 5 MB limit (FE-902).

Steps to reproduce:

1. Have Fisheye index a file that is too large (over 5MB), producing the following warning:
{noformat}02:47:24 WARN  - [SubversionTest] Not indexing contents of HEAD of testing/test-bigger.xml because its size (13M) is too large (limit is 5M){noformat}
2. Create a Crucible review based on the file above, and start the review.
3. Click on the file in the Crucible review, it will show "Loading diff..." for a short time and then will eventually present the ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException.

Ideally, the user should be presented with a message saying that the Fisheye data couldn't be loaded because of the file size limit.  Attached is the full stack trace and a screen cap of the error.
fields.summary: ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException Loading File in Crucible Review with No Fisheye Data

fields.description: This has been fixed for HSQL in the 2.2 branch, needs to be fixed for mysql and postgres and merged to trunk and 2.3 branch.
fields.summary: fix upgrade_57.sql for mysql and postgres ala CRUC-2741

fields.description:
The theory is that natural page scrolling (rather than fixed footer) will be easier for the browser to render and so better performance.

- investigate cross-browser issues
- look at the work Seb has already done in this area.
fields.summary: Investigate strategies for moving to the use of natural page scrolling in FE/CRU

fields.description:
For 2.4:
- the LightSCM API will be deprecated, and Crucible-only will be made to run supported by a new pared-back FishEye (FishEye-light). For all bundled lightSCM plugins that to be supported by FishEye-light, delete the lightSCM plugin. For all other bundled lightSCM plugins (Conf, filesystem), mark them as deprecated.

Need to develop a plan for implementing this; how can we provide a minimal FishEye  behind the scenes of a Crucible-only instance to make Crucible function.
fields.summary: Plan for whats involved in deprecating and replacing LightSCM

fields.description: An effort to capture the current data model of all SCM data types as currently implemented in FECRU. This will form the basis of refactoring to better model SCM semantics. Should cover FE/CRU's current storage of revisions, changesets, branches, merges, tags, files, directories.
fields.summary: Document the FECRU SCM data model

fields.description:
Delivery is a plan to achieve:
- removal of nonfunctional UI components
- move to simplified changelog behaviour, that doesn't attempt to select individual from&to revisions, but rather works in terms of changesets only
- identify several "happy paths" for review creation and simply the number of steps in those paths
- see what's involved in doing away with the dialog and embedding review creation in the RHS of the review page, in a special "create" mode.
fields.summary: Spike to determine how we can fix the review creation screens

fields.description:
Hopefully this is reasonably straightforward.
include:
- spike implementation
- admin screen support
- automated test strategy
fields.summary: Spike to determine whats involved in support SSL via Jetty

fields.description:
Goal is to more fully embrace Spring IoC to drive down the "cost" of unit testing with better mocking. Work out the extent of work involved, develop plan for implementation.

Initial goal: remove {{AppConfig.getsConfig}}
fields.summary: investigation/spike to determine extent of work in more fully springifying FECRU

fields.description:
- Plugins 2.5
- SAL 2.1
- AUI 3.0.1 (for plugins?)
- Atlassian Event 2.0.3 (required for Plugins 2.5)
- REST 2.1 (for SAL - important)
fields.summary: perform common module + REST plugin upgrades

fields.description:
1. investigate and implement a functional test framework in FE/CRU
2. implement functional tests for the new setup UX work
3. document how to write functional tests in FE/CRU using the new framework
fields.summary: Create a functional test framework

fields.description:
Created by Ping Lyons from Matt Quail's Crucible comment on InlineCommentController.java line 192 https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3470#c31377 :

(@ping I know you didn't write it originally) but that {{setClipboardText}} is setup in an in-page {{<script>}} in {{snippetPage.tag}}.

Instead, either
* we should move it into a snippet.js
* consider moving it into a ZeroClipboard.java helper, and call that from the snippet module entrypoint.

@seb, thoughts?
fields.summary: Move snippet copy/paste javascript into GWT

fields.summary: Deleted repositories that are mapped to a project dumps NPE into logs when viewing projects page

fields.description:
Go to Admin > Create new project
Currently, the default repository drop down list populated based on the current user's permission who has access to the repo.

It should be populated with all the repositories regardless permission.

Workaround:
Login as an admin user who has permission to see that repository in order to create new project and specify default repository.
fields.summary: Default repository drop down list not being populated correctly when create new project

fields.description: see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-1675
fields.summary: Startup is broken for upgrades with licenses that have expired maintenance.

fields.description:
I could have missed something but I don't see a way I can differentiate in REST API between a login failure caused by bad password or CAPTCHA kicking in.

Crucible /rest-service/auth-v1/login always returns HTTP/403, every time a response body is:

{code}
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?><loginResult><error>authentication failed</error></loginResult>
{code}

That's bad from Atlassian Connector for Eclipse perspective - we can't tell the user to use Web UI and CAPTCHA to unlock REST API.

Please either change response body to something more meaningful or let's use some HTTP code for this.

We need to be able to tell the user REST API has been locked.
fields.summary: Rest login method is ambigous for CAPTCHA
Use JavaScript to obtain the license callback URL in the /setup screens

fields.description: either by providing a method on the rest api and/or adding details to the ReviewData object

We should use the interface name that is configured, or localhost instead.

fields.description:
When logged in as myself in Crucible, I log some time using the Submit time to JIRA dialog.  When I go to JIRA to view the worklog, the user who has logged the work is Jira Administrator.

I would expect my username to be the one recorded as logging the work.
fields.summary: When manually entering time in the "Submit time to JIRA" dialog, the JIRA worklog shows that the work was logged by the JIRA Administrator, not the user who entered the time

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 

# Integrate your JIRA server with Crucible so that reviews will be autolinked to JIRA issues
# Commit a changeset to your repository referencing a jira issue e.g. TST-3
# Suspend the JIRA instance using something like {{kill -s SIGSTOP <pid>}} to simulate a non responsive instance
# Try to create a review from the changeset referencing TST-3. If the JIRA issue is not already in the cache, Crucible will make a remote call to JIRA to get the issue details. Since we suspended JIRA (or if JIRA is actually not responding) Crucible will just hang and the spinning wheel throbber will never go away.
!http://img.skitch.com/20100524-1e5a4k46hthjciiajbddfs9xgh.jpg! 
\\ \\ 

We should put some sort of timeout after which the issue linking fails with a message saying JIRA was not responding and the auto-linking failed.
fields.summary: Creating a review hangs when automatically linking JIRA issues to reviews if JIRA isn't responsive.
[IE] Can't create snippet

fields.description:
* When aggregating and returning a "Date" column, the value is always 1 Jan 1970, regardless of the dates on the contained revisions (when "group by changeset").
* If querying via a date, the linked "group contents" query string incorrectly quotes the date in the EyeQL, resulting in a syntax error on the linked to query.
* Displayed changeset id's in results with aggregates (using "group by changeset") show the long format (e.g. 40 char hash in git/hg) instead of the "nicely" formatted version.
fields.summary: EyeQL Aggregates: formatting and linking errors

This is not happening in version 2.1.3.

http://svn.atlassian.com/fisheye/cru/CR-513
fields.summary: Escaping wiki markup results in double-encoded entities

fields.summary: Error creating review from changeset

fields.description:
steps to reproduce:
# make a comment. Then make a reply to the comment.
# edit the reply, make a change, and save.
# click on a new line in the snippet. The comment form does not appear. 
# if you click on the reply to an existing comment, and make a reply, then the problem disappears and you can make new comments again.

----
||[!http://img.skitch.com/20100521-riynfhwyy3n4cek8mefjt4tjs6.png|width=400!|http://img.skitch.com/20100521-riynfhwyy3n4cek8mefjt4tjs6.png]||
fields.summary: cannot add new snippet comment after an edit on an existing comment

fields.description:
If the initial slurp thread count is set to 1 and there are more than 1 repos that need slurping, only one indicates that it is doing anything. The others appear to be "running" but with no status messages - i.e. they look like they are stuck.
After trying to figure out what was going on, I finally got the information that they are actually waiting on the other repo because it's initial slurp pool is set to a default of 1 thread.

Confusing!
fields.summary: Admin: Repository List->Status: "Running" is misleading when it's actually waiting!

fields.description:
If you try to find revisions that do not have any associated review with Eyeql, for example:
{noformat}
select revisions where (not in any review)
{noformat}
but it still includes revision in the review.

See the following screen shots:
[changeset.png|^changeset.png]
[search.png|^search.png]
fields.summary: EyeQL for revisions that do not have any associated review returns an invalid result
cs comments generate email notifications, but snippet comments do not

fields.description: All Open Snippets / All Snippets / My open Snippets / My Snippets
fields.summary: no listing of snippets
on submit, snippet title is lost and is replaced with synthetic title
IE8 snippet comment segments have black borders as "transparent" doesn't seem to work.
